content.description: This is the right most small boulder in the formation, set at a 90 degree angle to the rest of the face.Stand start on a horizontal crack. High step up the arete. Get a great incut pocket with the left hand, reach for the top, mantle. Caution:  the lower arete foothold looks weak (and, so, possibly transient in nature)
content.location: Continue down the trail past Roof Rock.  You will soon encounter a wedge shaped boulder that comes right down to the trail. 20 feet past the trailside wedge shaped boulder and 50 feet uphill you will find a low cliff face with a wide crack that hosts several easy problems.

content.description: Start low on crack/ledge. Go straight up. Careful pulling on the roof, holds feel weak.
content.location: Starts under the left part of the roof.

content.description: This problem is on the boulder to the left of the wide crack.Stand start from pockets on the arete. Move up and left using footholds on the face. The boulder on the right is off. Easy mantle.
content.location: Continue down the trail past Roof Rock.  You will soon encounter a wedge shaped boulder that comes right down to the trail. 20 feet past the trailside wedge shaped boulder and 50 feet uphill you will find a low cliff face with a wide crack that hosts several easy problems.

content.description: Climb the arete, then head left to top out over the ceiling. I recommend avoiding the obvious jug, as it sounds hollow.
Climb straight up the wide crack. Use the crack and holds on either arete but face holds are off
content.location: Continue down the trail past Roof Rock.  You will soon encounter a wedge shaped boulder that comes right down to the trail.  20 feet past the trailside wedge shaped boulder and 50 feet uphill you will find a low cliff face with a wide crack that hosts several easy problems.

content.description: Climb the face to the right of the crack. The boulder to the left is off.
content.location: Continue down the trail past Roof Rock.  You will soon encounter a wedge shaped boulder that comes right down to the trail. 20 feet past the trailside wedge shaped boulder and 50 feet uphill you will find a low cliff face with a wide crack that hosts several easy problems.Climb face to right of crack. The boulder to the left is off.

content.description: Tall Rock with nice pockets that lead up to a large crack under a 4 foot roof.
